translations: n．通货紧缩：指物价水平持续下降的经济现象，通常伴随着货币供应减少和需求下降。
· The government is trying to prevent deflations.
政府正试图防止通货紧缩。

sentences.sentence: The gold standard — which John Maynard Keynes termed a “barbarous relic” — led to ruinous deflations.
sentences.translation: 约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯称为“野蛮的遗迹”的金本位制导致了极大的破坏性。

sentences.sentence: The gold standard — which John Maynard Keynes termed a "barbarous relic" — led to ruinous deflations.
sentences.translation: 约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯称金本位制为“野蛮的遗迹”——导致了极大的破坏性。

sentences.sentence: In "normal" recessions such as the ones we have experienced in the postwar period prior to the present crisis, only the flow deflations were in operation.
sentences.translation: 在二战过后、本次危机之前的历次“正常衰退”中，都仅仅出现了流量型通缩。
